result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A. Thorson

defendant.name: Thorson, Nicholas A.
defendant.address: N6728 Hebling Rd., Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas A. Thorson
Current: N6728 Hebling Rd., Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-04-2015)
Prior: W1168 Dunlap Road, Merrillan, WI 54754
FIDR destroyed.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person from the jail, with Attorney Rivard.  This case was dismissed and read in for restitution purposes.  Victim rights notification complied with.  Court questioned the state regarding the amount of restitution.  DA Fox gave approximate amounts.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights waived with the defendant.  Defendant stated he understood, no threats or promises made.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the defendant's plea.  The plea was entered, and constitutional rights were waived freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 03:30 pm
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State by telephone.  Attorney Rivard appeared by telephone.  Defendant did not appear.  Trial for tomorrow is canceled.  Plea set for 9:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jail.  Attorney Rivard appeared by telephone.  Parties are ready for trial on 14CF188 and 14CF190.  5/22/15 final date to settle.
State's
Status conference at 05-18-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Rivard appeared in court.  Attorney Rivard advised the court that the trial should remain on the 5/18 JT day.  Attorney Rivard will address bond at the 5/18 STC, if the trial is bumped.
from defendant's mother.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Rivard appeared in court.  Jury trials to stay on the calendar.  DA Fox will rank the cases at the final pre-trial.  Bond ordered continued.
Final pre-trial at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-28-2015 09:00 am
Status conference at 03-30-2015 03:00 pm

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Rivard appeared in court.  No agreement reached.  All cases set for STC on 3/30/15 at 3 pm.  Set 14CF188 as number 1 FPT & JT.  Set 14CF190 as number 2 FPT & JT.  Track all other open cases.

Pre-trial conference at 02-04-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-23-2015 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared in custody from JASO with counsel Francis Rivard.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Colloquy done for waiver of right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing on all open CF cases.  Bound over for trial and proceeded to arraignment.  Entered NGP's to all counts on all cases and set for pretrial and status dats.  Bond continued.  DA to file Information by Friday.

Status conference on January 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Also includes 14CF188
Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Keith C, or Wazee Sports or it's employees, Roger T Jr., Dawn Anderson or Austin Anderson. No check writing.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
No association with Dawn or Austin Anderson
